entry.title: Taproot NACK
entry.summary: The email conversation revolves around the Taproot protocol change in Bitcoin. LORD HIS EXCELLENCY JAMES HRMH expresses concern about increased privacy and the potential for obfuscation of transactions, which could lead to governments banning Bitcoin. He believes that the core functionality of Bitcoin must remain unaltered, and maintaining consensus values and the transparency of the blockchain is necessary. He also promotes the use of Bitcoin Mixer 2.0, a partner mixer run by Jambler.io, to enable standard equivalent privacy. Ariel Lorenzo-Luaces questions his promotion of a bitcoin mixer and asks for clarification regarding his association with it. Jeremy Rubin clarifies that Taproot does not enable Monero-like privacy features and that its core purpose is to make transactions with embedded smart contracts less expensive. The email includes links to various websites related to Bitcoin and Jambler.io.
